text.text: How do I itemize supplies in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To itemize supplies in ZOLL Billing, follow these steps:

1. Go to the "Billing" tab and click on "Supplies."
2. In the "Supplies" table, click on the "Add" button.
3. In the "Item" field, enter the name of the supply.
4. In the "Quantity" field, enter the quantity of the supply.
5. In the "Unit Price" field, enter the unit price of the supply.
6. In the "Total" field, enter the total cost of the supply.
7. Click on the "Save" button.

The supply will now be added to your billing record.

text.text: What types of supplies can be itemized in ZOLL Billing?

text:
The following supplies can be itemized in ZOLL Billing:

* ALS and BLS Routine Disposable Supplies (A0382 and A0398)
* ALS and BLS Defibrillation Supplies (A0384 and A0392)
* Esophageal Intubation Supplies (A0396)
* IV Drug Therapy Supplies (A0394)

I hope that helps!

text.text: Can you explain the process of adding an itemized charge for supplies?

text:
Sure, here are the steps to add an itemized charge for supplies:

1. Click **Settings** on the navigation bar.
2. Click the **Charges** tab.
3. Check the **View** field and verify that you are on the right charge category.
4. If you are then click **Itemize supplies**.

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

text.text: What do payers receive regarding itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text:
Payers receive the total cost of the used supplies as a single HCPCS.

If a payer needs to justify the amount, you can print the **"Print Charge Details"** report from the **Claim** page and send it to the payer.

Patient statements will contain the itemized list of supplies used.

text.text: How are itemized charges displayed on patient invoices?

text: The patient invoice will breakout every supply item used and list them on the invoice.

text.text: What is the purpose of adding an unlisted ambulance services charge?

text:
The purpose of adding an unlisted ambulance services charge is to bill for services that are not covered by the standard ambulance charges. This can include services such as:

* Patient transport to and from the hospital
* Patient transfer between hospitals
* Patient transport to and from a medical appointment
* Patient transport to and from a nursing home

To add an unlisted ambulance services charge, you will need to create a new charge code. The charge code should be unique and should not be used for any other purpose. You will also need to enter a description of the service and the amount of the charge.

Once you have created the charge code, you can add it to a claim. When you add the charge to the claim, you will need to specify the patient's insurance information. The insurance company will then review the claim and determine if they will cover the charge.

If the insurance company does not cover the charge, you will be responsible for paying the bill.

text.text: Could you guide me through the process of adding an unlisted ambulance services charge?

text:
Sure, I can help you with that.

To add an unlisted ambulance services charge, you can follow these steps:

1. Click **Settings** on the navigation bar.
2. Click the **Charges** tab.
3. Check the **View** field and verify that you are on the right charge category.
4. Click **Edit**.
5. Scroll down to the supply type heading you selected when you created the itemized supply.
6. You will see your entry there with an empty **Price per unit** field.
7. Enter the amount in this field.
8. Scroll down and click **Save**.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

text.text: When adding a new charge for unlisted ambulance services, what information do I need to provide?

text:
When adding a new charge for unlisted ambulance services, you need to provide the following information:

* The charge category
* The supply type
* The price per unit

You can find this information on the **Charges** page.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

text.text: How can I bill an A0999 charge to the patient only in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To bill an A0999 charge to the patient only, you can follow these steps:

1. Click the **Charges** tab and find the A0999 charge.
2. Click the **edit icon** next to that charge.
3. In the window that opens, click the circle next to **Patient only** and then click **Save**.

Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: What steps are involved in billing an A0999 charge exclusively to the patient?

text:
Sure, I can help you with that.

To bill an A0999 charge to the patient only, you can follow these steps:

1. Click the **Charges** tab and find the A0999 charge.
2. Click the **edit icon** next to that charge.
3. In the window that opens, click the circle next to **Patient only** and then click **Save**.

Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: Is it possible to modify an A0999 charge to bill it only to the patient?

text:
Yes, it is possible to modify an A0999 charge to bill it only to the patient. To do this, you can follow these steps:

1. Click the **Charges** tab and find the A0999 charge.
2. Click the **edit icon** next to that charge.
3. In the window that opens, click the circle next to **Patient only** and then click **Save**.

Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: What does the "Patient only" option signify for an A0999 charge?

text: The "Patient only" option for an A0999 charge means that the charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.

text.text: Can you describe the significance of the "Price per unit" field when adding an itemized charge?

text: The "Price per unit" field is used to enter the **price per unit** for the itemized charge.

text.text: How do I save changes made to itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To save changes made to itemized charges in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps:

1. Click the **Edit** button at the top right of the page.
2. Click the **Save** button at the bottom of the page.

I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

text.text: Where can I find the charges tab to manage itemized charges in ZOLL Billing?

text: To get to the Charges tab, you can click **Settings** on the navigation bar. You can then click the **Charges** tab. You can also click the **Itemize supplies** link at the top of the page.

text.text: how to add itemized charge? explain in detail.

text:
Sure, I can help you with that. Here are the steps on how to add an itemized charge:

1. Click **Settings** on the navigation bar.
2. Click the **Charges** tab.
3. Check the **View** field and verify that you are on the right charge category.
4. If you are, then click **Itemize supplies**.

text.text: explain itemized supplies

text: Sure, I can help you with that. Itemized supplies are supplies that are **billed to a patient or payer for each supply**. The decision to itemize supplies is something your company decides to do. If your medics track the supplies they use during transport, and you want to bill for each supply, then create your list of supply types and enter their prices. After you create the itemized list, you can add the supplies to your claim. ZOLL Billing will sum the cost of the used supplies and send payers the total as a single HCPCS.

text.text: explain using itemized supplies

text:
Sure, I can help you with that. Here are the steps on how to use itemized supplies:

1. Click **Settings** on the navigation bar.
2. Click the **Charges** tab.
3. Click the **View** field to select the charge category.
4. Click the **Edit** icon.
5. Find the charge description that you wish to change and click the description field for that charge.
6. After typing the new name, tab out of the field. If you click **Save** before you tab out of the field, your change will not be recorded.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=6bsx0y73ks

In the window that opens, click the circle next to **Patient only** and then click **Save**. Now, the A0999 charge will only appear when you are billing the patient.
